item.title: I drew some pictures for two people today
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Get On With IT!
item.description: A phrase I used at the beginning to help push myself to keep moving.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: You Got Out.
item.description: A new friend from the internet sent me the most lovely message which I had to condense into a new poster for myself. Thank you <3
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Visualizing a feud between Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant
item.description: I dreamt a very dream. In which I had to get this tattooed above my belly button. I was very proud of it in my dream before I actually looked at it. The absurdity of the image is what woke me. haha.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Daily
item.description: I drew this a long time ago. No date. It is still apropriate to me today.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Chronos is on your Side
item.description:
Chronos, the greek god of all standing time. This was used to remind me that in the long run things will be different. To remember that what might hurt today might not hurt later if I keep working, changing, evolving.

Time does lots of things, and truly, it is most often on your side.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Feeling from 2010
item.description: I was rather proud of this when I drew it. Still am.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra

item.title: Not my time
item.description:
I can get pretty dark sometimes eh? I often feel that one reason I can't find a way out of my darkness is because of how reluctant I am to share my true feelings with people.

I don't want this life. I don't want this pain. And there must be some legitimate reasons to choose your own death. But I cannot discuss this with people in my life.

I feel like the last five years of my life have been all about one thing: What are the list of things I need to try before it is okay for me to die? If I try them all and I still have no relief, then it will be okay. I know I have yet to exhaust that list.
item.dc:creator: Luna Umbra
